```
Placement Mode (highlight valid spots for this item)
    - Calligraphy: ONLY tokonoma wall (1 spot)
    - Origami: Tokonoma floor-right, floor-left (2 spots)
    - Lantern: Tokonoma floor-right, floor-left, floor-front (3 spots)
    ‚Üì
Item Placed (immediately appears in scene)
    ‚Üì
[Loop 3 times: Exploration ‚Üí Mini-game ‚Üí Placement]
    ‚Üì
Room Completion (all 3 items placed)
```

---

## **üé• Camera System Design:**

### **Room Exploration Mode:**

**Behavior:**
- **Fixed position** in space (orbit center point)
- **Limited rotation** (horizontal: 180-270¬∞, vertical: ¬±30¬∞)
- **Mouse/analog stick** controls camera look direction
- **Center cursor/crosshair** for targeting stations
- **Smooth damping** on rotation (not instant snap)

**Station Selection:**
- **Raycast from camera center** to detect stations
- **Highlight shader** activates when station in crosshair
- **"Press [E] / Click to Craft"** tooltip appears
- **Click or key press** ‚Üí zoom to station and start mini-game

**Visual Representation:**
```
        [Tokonoma Wall]
             |
    [Floor Left]  [Floor Right]
             |
        [Floor Front]
             
         ‚Üë Camera orbit point
      (player view here)
```

**Constraints:**
- Can't move behind tokonoma (would see through wall)
- Vertical angle limits prevent ceiling/floor clipping
- Orbit radius fixed (no zoom in/out in exploration)

---

## **üèÆ Station Visual Cue System:**

### **Empty Room Problem Solution:**

#### **Semi-Transparent Station Objects:**

**Origami Station:**
- Ghost image of folded mat/cushion on floor
- Subtle outline glow
- Maybe floating paper particles
- Opacity: 30-40%

**Calligraphy Station:**
- Faint hanging scroll outline on wall
- Brush and inkstone ghost on floor
- Gentle shimmer effect
- Opacity: 30-40%

**Lantern Station:**
- Translucent lantern frame
- Soft light beam from above (where it will hang/sit)
- Paper texture hints
- Opacity: 30-40%

**Interaction States:**
```
Not Selected:
    - Semi-transparent (40%)
    - Gentle idle pulse (breathing effect)
    
Cursor Hover (centered):
    - Highlight outline (bright color)
    - Opacity increases to 60%
    - Tooltip appears
    - Audio: soft chime
    
Completed:
    - Ghost disappears
    - Real object visible
    - Maybe subtle glow around real item
```

---

## **üìç Placement Spot System:**

### **Spot Definitions:**

```
Tokonoma Wall (1 spot):
    - Type: Calligraphy ONLY
    - Position: Center of back wall, eye level
    - Visual: Rectangular outline when highlighted
    
Tokonoma Floor Right (1 spot):
    - Type: Origami OR Lantern
    - Position: Right side of tokonoma floor
    - Visual: Circular/square pad outline
    
Tokonoma Floor Left (1 spot):
    - Type: Origami OR Lantern
    - Position: Left side of tokonoma floor
    - Visual: Circular/square pad outline
    
Tokonoma Floor Front (1 spot):
    - Type: Lantern ONLY
    - Position: Front center, slightly forward
    - Visual: Circular outline (lantern-sized)
```

### **Placement Logic:**

**After Calligraphy Complete:**
- Only 1 valid spot (wall) ‚Üí auto-highlight
- Player clicks ‚Üí item appears on wall
- No choice needed (streamlined)

**After Origami Complete:**
- 2-3 valid spots highlighted (exclude wall, exclude already occupied)
- Player chooses which floor spot
- Click ‚Üí origami appears there

**After Lantern Complete:**
- 2-3 valid spots highlighted (exclude wall, exclude already occupied)
- Player chooses where lantern goes
- Click ‚Üí lantern appears there

**Smart Highlighting:**
- If 2 spots already occupied, remaining spot auto-selected
- Only show available spots (not occupied ones)
- Different highlight colors per item type? (optional polish)

---

## **üîß State Machine Refinement:**

### **Updated States:**

```csharp
enum GameState
{
    MainMenu,
    RoomExploration,    // Looking around, selecting station
    PlayingMiniGame,    // Active mini-game (origami/calligraphy/lantern)
    PlacingItem,        // Choosing where to place completed item
    RoomCompletion,     // All 3 placed, celebration
    Paused
}
```

### **State Transitions:**

```
MainMenu
    ‚Üì (Start Game)
RoomExploration
    ‚Üì (Click station #1)
PlayingMiniGame (context: which game)
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem (context: which item, valid spots)
    ‚Üì (Place)
RoomExploration (1/3 items done)
    ‚Üì (Click station #2)
PlayingMiniGame
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem
    ‚Üì (Place)
RoomExploration (2/3 items done)
    ‚Üì (Click station #3)
PlayingMiniGame
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem
    ‚Üì (Place, all 3 complete)
RoomCompletion
```

### **State Data Tracking:**

```
Progress Tracking:
    - bool origamiCompleted
    - bool calligraphyCompleted
    - bool lanternCompleted
    
    - GameObject origamiPlaced (null if not placed)
    - GameObject calligraphyPlaced
    - GameObject lanternPlaced
    
    - List<Vector3> occupiedSpots
    
Win Condition:
    - All 3 crafted AND all 3 placed
```

---

## **‚öôÔ∏è Configurable Timing Settings:**

### **Inspector-Exposed Parameters:**

```
[Header("Transition Timing")]
public float successDisplayTime = 2f;
public float cameraTransitionDuration = 1.5f;
public float placementHighlightDelay = 0.5f;

[Header("Camera Movement")]
public float orbitRotationSpeed = 2f;
public float stationZoomDuration = 1.2f;

[Header("Visual Feedback")]
public float stationHighlightIntensity = 1.5f;
public float ghostObjectOpacity = 0.4f;
```

**Allows easy playtesting adjustments without code changes**

---

## **üéØ Camera Zones & Boundaries:**

### **Rotation Limits:**

```
Horizontal (Y-axis):
    - Min: 0¬∞ (facing tokonoma dead-on)
    - Max: 180¬∞ (max left/right from center)
    - Player can look left/right but not behind

Vertical (X-axis):
    - Min: -20¬∞ (looking slightly down)
    - Max: +30¬∞ (looking up at wall scroll)
    - Prevents floor/ceiling awkwardness
```

### **Station Detection Zones:**

```
Each station has:
    - Transform position (world space)
    - Collider (for raycast detection)
    - Highlight radius (how close cursor needs to be)
    - Camera target position (where camera zooms to)
```

---

## **üì¶ Placement Spot Data Structure:**

### **Proposed Class:**

```
PlacementSpot:
    - Vector3 position
    - Quaternion rotation
    - PlacementType allowedTypes (enum flags)
    - bool isOccupied
    - GameObject currentItem (null if empty)
    
PlacementType Enum:
    - Calligraphy = 1
    - Origami = 2
    - Lantern = 4
    - (allows bitwise: Origami | Lantern = 6)
```

### **Spot Validation:**

```
Can Place Item Here?
    1. Is spot occupied? ‚Üí NO
    2. Does item type match allowed types? ‚Üí YES
    3. Highlight spot
```

---

## **üé® Visual Feedback Progression:**

### **Room Evolution:**

```
Empty Room (Start):
    - Semi-transparent station ghosts visible
    - Dim ambient lighting
    - Quiet background audio
    - No items
    
1 Item Placed:
    - Ghost disappears for that station
    - Real item appears with subtle glow
    - Ambient light slightly warmer
    - Harmony meter: 33%
    
2 Items Placed:
    - 2 ghosts gone, 2 real items
    - Room noticeably brighter
    - Background audio fuller
    - Harmony meter: 66%
    
3 Items Placed (Complete):
    - All ghosts gone
    - All real items glowing
    - Room fully lit and warm
    - Harmony meter: 100%
    - Completion animation triggers
```

---

## **üîÑ Mini-Game Controller Adjustments Needed:**

### **New Responsibilities:**

1. **Context Tracking:**
   - Which station triggered the mini-game?
   - What are valid placement spots for this item?

2. **Placement Mode:**
   - After mini-game ‚Üí show placement UI
   - Highlight valid spots based on item type
   - Wait for player click
   - Place item at chosen spot

3. **Progress Tracking:**
   - Track which items completed
   - Disable completed station ghosts
   - Check win condition (all 3 placed)

---

## **üéÆ Input Handling:**

### **Room Exploration:**
- **Mouse Move / Right Stick** ‚Üí Rotate camera
- **Left Click / A Button** ‚Üí Select highlighted station
- **ESC / Start** ‚Üí Pause menu

### **Placement Mode:**
- **Mouse Move / Stick** ‚Üí Highlight different spots
- **Left Click / A Button** ‚Üí Confirm placement
- **No cancel** (immediate placement, Approach 1)

---

## **üèóÔ∏è Implementation Priority:**

### **Phase 1 (Core Loop):**
1. Camera orbit system with rotation limits
2. Station ghost objects (simple cubes/spheres to start)
3. Raycast selection with highlight
4. Zoom to station ‚Üí play mini-game
5. Return to orbit after completion

### **Phase 2 (Placement):**
1. Define placement spots (Transform markers in scene)
2. Placement UI highlighting system
3. Click spot ‚Üí place item logic
4. Occupied spot tracking

### **Phase 3 (Polish):**
1. Replace ghost cubes with proper semi-transparent models
2. Highlight shaders
3. Configurable timing parameters
4. Audio feedback
5. Harmony meter

---

## **‚ùì Open Questions:**

1. **Camera Orbit Center:** Should it be at player eye-level (1.5m) or lower (0.8m sitting view)?

2. **Station Ghost Models:** 
   - Use actual item models at low opacity?
   - Or abstract symbols (icon floating above spot)?

3. **Placement Confirmation:**
   - Single click = instant placement?
   - Or click once to preview, click again to confirm?

4. **First-Time Tutorial:**
   - Show "Look around and select a station" prompt?
   - Or let player discover naturally?

5. **Multiple Rooms:**
   - This flow works for Room 1
   - Same flow for Room 2/3 with different items?
   - Or unlock new mechanics in later rooms?

---

## **üéØ Next Steps:**

This design gives you:
- ‚úÖ Discovery feel without locked content
- ‚úÖ Camera freedom within reasonable bounds  
- ‚úÖ Immediate placement (no inventory complexity)
- ‚úÖ Flexible placement for lantern/origami
- ‚úÖ Configurable timing for playtesting
- ‚úÖ Clear loop structure (3 iterations)

**Ready to implement the camera orbit system and station selection mechanics?** That would be the logical starting point for this flow. üé•

For Game Flow: I like something similar to Option 4: Discoverly. I don't know if I want the minigames locked until its found though. That might add too much. Also, it might leave player without guideline. Maybe similar system but with already unlocked view. 
For UI/UX: Some balance of A and C, I like free camera movement but it will be too much to create entire room. Maybe limit camera movement to certain boundary with only limited rotation no movement, and select station by camera cursor (center camera to station) and click to go into game. Probably have some visual cue such as heighlight.
Inventory management: Approach 1 is good. Not having to deal with it.
State Machine: Option 4 looks good since we are doing similar to discovery. It will have to loop 3 times at Room Exploration States since we have 3 mini game though.

However lantern and origami can be a little more flexible. Transition: Go with relaxed pace as a baseline. Lets make the time configurable through unity editor. I'll do some play test.
Visual feedback lets decide later. I need to make it in the way thats not confusing with minigame visuals. We will probably start with empty room though. Problem is having visual cue for station in an empty room. Maybe semmi-transparent object?

```csharp
    RoomCompletion,     // All 3 placed, celebration
    Paused
}
```

### **State Transitions:**

```
MainMenu
    ‚Üì (Start Game)
RoomExploration
    ‚Üì (Click station #1)
PlayingMiniGame (context: which game)
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem (context: which item, valid spots)
    ‚Üì (Place)
RoomExploration (1/3 items done)
    ‚Üì (Click station #2)
PlayingMiniGame
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem
    ‚Üì (Place)
RoomExploration (2/3 items done)
    ‚Üì (Click station #3)
PlayingMiniGame
    ‚Üì (Complete)
PlacingItem
    ‚Üì (Place, all 3 complete)
RoomCompletion
```

### **State Data Tracking:**

```
Progress Tracking:
    - bool origamiCompleted
    - bool calligraphyCompleted
    - bool lanternCompleted
    
    - GameObject origamiPlaced (null if not placed)
    - GameObject calligraphyPlaced
    - GameObject lanternPlaced
    
    - List<Vector3> occupiedSpots
    
Win Condition:
    - All 3 crafted AND all 3 placed
```

---

## **‚öôÔ∏è Configurable Timing Settings:**

### **Inspector-Exposed Parameters:**

```
[Header("Transition Timing")]
public float successDisplayTime = 2f;
public float cameraTransitionDuration = 1.5f;
public float placementHighlightDelay = 0.5f;

[Header("Camera Movement")]
public float orbitRotationSpeed = 2f;
public float stationZoomDuration = 1.2f;

[Header("Visual Feedback")]
public float stationHighlightIntensity = 1.5f;
public float ghostObjectOpacity = 0.4f;
```

**Allows easy playtesting adjustments without code changes**

---

## **üéØ Camera Zones & Boundaries:**

### **Rotation Limits:**

```
Horizontal (Y-axis):
    - Min: 0¬∞ (facing tokonoma dead-on)
    - Max: 180¬∞ (max left/right from center)
    - Player can look left/right but not behind

Vertical (X-axis):
    - Min: -20¬∞ (looking slightly down)
    - Max: +30¬∞ (looking up at wall scroll)
    - Prevents floor/ceiling awkwardness
```

### **Station Detection Zones:**

```
Each station has:
    - Transform position (world space)
    - Collider (for raycast detection)
    - Highlight radius (how close cursor needs to be)
    - Camera target position (where camera zooms to)
```

---

## **üì¶ Placement Spot Data Structure:**

### **Proposed Class:**

```
PlacementSpot:
    - Vector3 position
    - Quaternion rotation
    - PlacementType allowedTypes (enum flags)
    - bool isOccupied
    - GameObject currentItem (null if empty)
    
PlacementType Enum:
    - Calligraphy = 1
    - Origami = 2
    - Lantern = 4
    - (allows bitwise: Origami | Lantern = 6)
```

### **Spot Validation:**

```
Can Place Item Here?
    1. Is spot occupied? ‚Üí NO
    2. Does item type match allowed types? ‚Üí YES
    3. Highlight spot
```

---

## **üé® Visual Feedback Progression:**

### **Room Evolution:**

```
Empty Room (Start):
    - Semi-transparent station ghosts visible
    - Dim ambient lighting
    - Quiet background audio
    - No items
    
1 Item Placed:
    - Ghost disappears for that station
    - Real item appears with subtle glow
    - Ambient light slightly warmer
    - Harmony meter: 33%
    
2 Items Placed:
    - 2 ghosts gone, 2 real items
    - Room noticeably brighter
    - Background audio fuller
    - Harmony meter: 66%
    
3 Items Placed (Complete):
    - All ghosts gone
    - All real items glowing
    - Room fully lit and warm
    - Harmony meter: 100%
    - Completion animation triggers
```

---

## **üîÑ Mini-Game Controller Adjustments Needed:**

### **New Responsibilities:**

1. **Context Tracking:**
   - Which station triggered the mini-game?
   - What are valid placement spots for this item?

2. **Placement Mode:**
   - After mini-game ‚Üí show placement UI
   - Highlight valid spots based on item type
   - Wait for player click
   - Place item at chosen spot

3. **Progress Tracking:**
   - Track which items completed
   - Disable completed station ghosts
   - Check win condition (all 3 placed)

---

## **üéÆ Input Handling:**

### **Room Exploration:**
- **Mouse Move / Right Stick** ‚Üí Rotate camera
- **Left Click / A Button** ‚Üí Select highlighted station
- **ESC / Start** ‚Üí Pause menu

### **Placement Mode:**
- **Mouse Move / Stick** ‚Üí Highlight different spots
- **Left Click / A Button** ‚Üí Confirm placement
- **No cancel** (immediate placement, Approach 1)

---

## **üèóÔ∏è Implementation Priority:**

### **Phase 1 (Core Loop):**
1. Camera orbit system with rotation limits
2. Station ghost objects (simple cubes/spheres to start)
3. Raycast selection with highlight
4. Zoom to station ‚Üí play mini-game
5. Return to orbit after completion

### **Phase 2 (Placement):**
1. Define placement spots (Transform markers in scene)
2. Placement UI highlighting system
3. Click spot ‚Üí place item logic
4. Occupied spot tracking

### **Phase 3 (Polish):**
1. Replace ghost cubes with proper semi-transparent models
2. Highlight shaders
3. Configurable timing parameters
4. Audio feedback
5. Harmony meter

---

## **‚ùì Open Questions:**

1. **Camera Orbit Center:** Should it be at player eye-level (1.5m) or lower (0.8m sitting view)?

2. **Station Ghost Models:** 
   - Use actual item models at low opacity?
   - Or abstract symbols (icon floating above spot)?

3. **Placement Confirmation:**
   - Single click = instant placement?
   - Or click once to preview, click again to confirm?

4. **First-Time Tutorial:**
   - Show "Look around and select a station" prompt?
   - Or let player discover naturally?

5. **Multiple Rooms:**
   - This flow works for Room 1
   - Same flow for Room 2/3 with different items?
   - Or unlock new mechanics in later rooms?

---

## **üéØ Next Steps:**

This design gives you:
- ‚úÖ Discovery feel without locked content
- ‚úÖ Camera freedom within reasonable bounds  
- ‚úÖ Immediate placement (no inventory complexity)
- ‚úÖ Flexible placement for lantern/origami
- ‚úÖ Configurable timing for playtesting
- ‚úÖ Clear loop structure (3 iterations)

**Ready to implement the camera orbit system and station selection mechanics?** That would be the logical starting point for this flow. üé•

edits.text:
## üß© Architecture Notes

**Single Unity scene** for simplicity (recommended for 1-month dev).

**State Flow:**
- `RoomExploration` ‚Üí camera orbit, spot selection via raycast from center cursor.
- `PlayingMiniGame` ‚Üí active mini-game (origami/calligraphy/lantern).
- `PlacingItem` ‚Üí highlight valid spots, player chooses where to place.
- Loop 3 times until `RoomCompletion`.

**Camera System:**
- Orbit controller with rotation limits (horizontal: 180¬∞, vertical: ¬±30¬∞).
- Coroutine-based smooth transitions with AnimationCurve easing.
- `IsMoving` property for transition state tracking.

**Placement Spot System:**
- Each spot has: position, rotation, allowed item types (enum flags), occupied state.
- Tokonoma Wall: Calligraphy only (1 spot).
- Floor Right/Left/Front: Origami or Lantern (2-3 flexible spots).
- Smart highlighting: only show available, unoccupied spots matching current item.

**Mini-Game Architecture:**
- Separate scripts: `LanternGame` (logic), `LanternUI` (display), `LanternVisual` (emission).
- Event-driven: mini-game fires `OnGameCompleted` ‚Üí `MiniGameController` handles transition.
- Transition flow: success display (configurable time) ‚Üí camera return ‚Üí placement mode.

**Managers:**
- `GameManager`: State machine, high-level flow.
- `MiniGameController`: Mini-game lifecycle, post-completion transitions.
- `UIManager`: Panel-based UI organization.
- `AudioManager`: Sound effects and ambient audio.
- `RoomController`: Placement logic, harmony meter, completion sequence.
- `CameraController`: Orbit mode + zoom transitions.

**Visual Feedback:**
- Semi-transparent ghost objects (30-40% opacity) at empty spots.
- Highlight shader when cursor centers on spot.
- Real items replace ghosts after placement.
- Room lighting evolves as harmony meter fills.

**Data-driven rooms:** ScriptableObjects define lighting, theme, and mini-game difficulty (future expansion).

**Art:** Free CC0 textures (tatami, fusuma, wood) and simple 3D geometry.

**Sound:** Gentle ambience, chimes on selection, paper/ink SFX.

## üóìÔ∏è Development Progress

**‚úÖ Completed:**
- GameManager state flow system with events.
- Lantern mini-game with progress bar UI (LanternGame, LanternUI, LanternVisual).
- Camera controller with coroutine-based smooth transitions.
- MiniGameController transition system (success ‚Üí room ‚Üí placement).
- Event-driven architecture (mini-game completion ‚Üí transition ‚Üí placement).

**üöß In Progress:**
- Camera orbit system for room exploration.
- Placement spot selection with raycast and highlights.

**üìã Next Steps:**
1. Implement camera orbit controller with rotation limits and center cursor targeting.
2. Create placement spot system (Transform markers, PlacementSpot data class).
3. Add semi-transparent ghost objects for empty spots.
4. Implement spot highlighting and click-to-start mini-game flow.
5. Build placement mode UI (highlight valid spots, click to place).
6. Test full loop: explore ‚Üí select spot ‚Üí play ‚Üí place ‚Üí repeat √ó 3.
7. Clone Lantern logic for Origami (arrow keys) and Calligraphy (brush rhythm).
8. Implement harmony meter and room completion animation.
9. Integrate audio and polish lighting transitions.
10. Playtest and adjust configurable timing parameters.

edits.text: # üèØ Project Summary ‚Äì The Little Zen Atelier
A calm, minimalist 3D Unity simulation game inspired by Japanese arts.
The player explores a Zen room, discovers three placement spots (tokonoma wall, floor areas), and completes mini-games ‚Äî Origami, Calligraphy, and Lantern ‚Äî to create decorative items.
Each crafted item is placed in the room, gradually bringing harmony to the space with soft lighting, gentle camera motion, and ambient sound.
**Main Menu** ‚Üí start game, select room, settings.

- Semi-transparent ghost objects mark where items will go (tokonoma wall, floor positions).
- Center camera cursor on a spot ‚Üí highlight activates.
- Click highlighted spot ‚Üí zoom to that location and start corresponding mini-game.
- **Origami:** Press correct arrow keys for folding accuracy (floor spots).
- **Calligraphy:** Keep brush speed consistent with hold/release rhythm (wall spot only).
- **Lantern:** Hold/release SPACE to keep brightness bar in green "harmony zone" (floor spots).
- After completing a mini-game, camera returns to room.
- Valid placement spots highlight (based on item type and availability).
- Calligraphy: Must go on tokonoma wall (1 spot only).
- Origami/Lantern: Flexible placement on 2-3 floor spots around tokonoma.
- Click to place item ‚Üí appears immediately, ghost disappears.
**Harmony Meter:** Fills as items are placed (33% ‚Üí 66% ‚Üí 100%); when full, triggers room completion.
- Orbit mode for exploration (limited rotation, no movement).
- Smooth zoom transitions to/from placement spots.
- Empty room starts with semi-transparent ghost objects.
- Real items replace ghosts as they're crafted and placed.
- Lighting and ambience evolve as room fills.
**Audio:** Ambient sounds, gentle chimes on selection, paper/ink SFX during mini-games.
**Single Unity scene** for simplicity (recommended for 1-month dev).
- `RoomExploration` ‚Üí camera orbit, spot selection via raycast from center cursor.
- `PlacingItem` ‚Üí highlight valid spots, player chooses where to place.
- Orbit controller with rotation limits (horizontal: 180¬∞, vertical: ¬±30¬∞).

- Each spot has: position, rotation, allowed item types (enum flags), occupied state.
- Placement spots double as mini-game triggers (click spot ‚Üí play game ‚Üí place item there).
- Floor Right/Left/Front: Origami or Lantern (2-3 flexible spots).
- Smart highlighting: only show available, unoccupied spots matching current item.
- Transition flow: success display (configurable time) ‚Üí camera return ‚Üí placement mode.
- `RoomController`: Placement logic, harmony meter, completion sequence.
- Semi-transparent ghost objects (30-40% opacity) at empty placement spots.
- Highlight shader when cursor centers on spot.
- Real items replace ghosts after placement.
- Room lighting evolves as harmony meter fills.
**Data-driven rooms:** ScriptableObjects define lighting, theme, and mini-game difficulty (future expansion).
**Art:** Free CC0 textures (tatami, fusuma, wood) and simple 3D geometry.
**Sound:** Gentle ambience, chimes on selection, paper/ink SFX.

- ‚úÖ No separate stations - the ghost objects themselves are interactive

# üèØ Project Summary ‚Äì The Little Zen Atelier

A calm, minimalist 3D Unity simulation game inspired by Japanese arts.
The player completes three short, non-violent mini-games ‚Äî Origami, Calligraphy, and Lantern ‚Äî to create decorative items and bring harmony to small Zen rooms.
Each finished room becomes a relaxing space with soft lighting, gentle camera motion, and ambient sound.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Core Features

Main Menu ‚Üí start game, select room, settings.

Mini-games (UI-based prefabs):

Origami: press correct arrow keys for accuracy.

Calligraphy: keep brush speed consistent (hold/release rhythm).

Lantern: hold/release to keep a brightness bar in the green ‚Äúharmony‚Äù zone.

Guided Placement: each crafted item is placed in a fixed highlighted spot within the room.

Harmony Meter: fills as crafts are placed; when full, triggers room completion animation.

Menus: pause and summary screens.

Lighting: ambient + lantern glow.

Camera: smooth pans/zooms between crafting, placement, and completion scenes.

Animation: folding, brush flow, lantern glow via Unity animation or simple kinematic scripts.

## üß© Architecture Notes

Single Unity scene for simplicity (recommended for 1-month dev).

Prefabs: each mini-game, placement spot, and UI panel.

Managers: GameManager, UIManager, AudioManager, RoomController, MiniGameController.

Shared Input/UI: reusable ‚ÄúSuccessBar‚Äù script (green zone logic).

Data-driven rooms: ScriptableObjects define lighting, theme, and mini-game difficulty.

Art: free CC0 textures (tatami, fusuma, wood) and simple 3D geometry.

Sound: gentle ambience, chimes, paper/ink SFX.

## üóìÔ∏è Development Focus

Build main menu + GameManager state flow.

Implement one mini-game (Lantern) with SuccessBar UI ‚Üí test full loop.

Clone logic for Origami and Calligraphy.

Add placement + room completion sequence.

Integrate audio, polish lighting and camera transitions.
</attachment>

</attachments>

toolCalls.arguments:
{"filePath": "d:\D Drive Documents\CS583-3DProject\README.md", "content": "# üèØ Project Summary ‚Äì The Little Zen Atelier

A calm, minimalist 3D Unity simulation game inspired by Japanese arts.
The player explores a Zen room, discovers three placement spots (tokonoma wall, floor areas), and completes mini-games ‚Äî Origami, Calligraphy, and Lantern ‚Äî to create decorative items.
Each crafted item is placed in the room, gradually bringing harmony to the space with soft lighting, gentle camera motion, and ambient sound.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Core Features

**Main Menu** ‚Üí start game, select room, settings.

**Room Exploration** ‚Üí orbit camera with limited rotation to look around the tokonoma area.

**Placement Spot Discovery:**
- Semi-transparent ghost objects mark where items will go (tokonoma wall, floor positions).
- Center camera cursor on a spot ‚Üí highlight activates.
- Click highlighted spot ‚Üí zoom to that location and start corresponding mini-game.

**Mini-games** (UI-based, triggered by placement spots):
- **Origami:** Press correct arrow keys for folding accuracy (floor spots).
- **Calligraphy:** Keep brush speed consistent with hold/release rhythm (wall spot only).
- **Lantern:** Hold/release SPACE to keep brightness bar in green "harmony zone" (floor spots).

**Immediate Placement:**
- After completing a mini-game, camera returns to room.
- Valid placement spots highlight (based on item type and availability).
- Calligraphy: Must go on tokonoma wall (1 spot only).
- Origami/Lantern: Flexible placement on 2-3 floor spots around tokonoma.
- Click to place item ‚Üí appears immediately, ghost disappears.

**Harmony Meter:** Fills as items are placed (33% ‚Üí 66% ‚Üí 100%); when full, triggers room completion.

**Camera System:**
- Orbit mode for exploration (limited rotation, no movement).
- Smooth zoom transitions to/from placement spots.
- Configurable timing for playtesting.

**Visual Progression:**
- Empty room starts with semi-transparent ghost objects.
- Real items replace ghosts as they're crafted and placed.
- Lighting and ambience evolve as room fills.

**Audio:** Ambient sounds, gentle chimes on selection, paper/ink SFX during mini-games.

## üß© Architecture Notes

**Single Unity scene** for simplicity (recommended for 1-month dev).

**State Flow:**
- `RoomExploration` ‚Üí camera orbit, spot selection via raycast from center cursor.
- `PlayingMiniGame` ‚Üí active mini-game (origami/calligraphy/lantern).
- `PlacingItem` ‚Üí highlight valid spots, player chooses where to place.
- Loop 3 times until `RoomCompletion`.

**Camera System:**
- Orbit controller with rotation limits (horizontal: 180¬∞, vertical: ¬±30¬∞).
- Coroutine-based smooth transitions with AnimationCurve easing.
- `IsMoving` property for transition state tracking.

**Placement Spot System:**
- Each spot has: position, rotation, allowed item types (enum flags), occupied state.
- Placement spots double as mini-game triggers (click spot ‚Üí play game ‚Üí place item there).
- Tokonoma Wall: Calligraphy only (1 spot).
- Floor Right/Left/Front: Origami or Lantern (2-3 flexible spots).
- Smart highlighting: only show available, unoccupied spots matching current item.

**Mini-Game Architecture:**
- Separate scripts: `LanternGame` (logic), `LanternUI` (display), `LanternVisual` (emission).
- Event-driven: mini-game fires `OnGameCompleted` ‚Üí `MiniGameController` handles transition.
- Transition flow: success display (configurable time) ‚Üí camera return ‚Üí placement mode.

**Managers:**
- `GameManager`: State machine, high-level flow.
- `MiniGameController`: Mini-game lifecycle, post-completion transitions.
- `UIManager`: Panel-based UI organization.
- `AudioManager`: Sound effects and ambient audio.
- `RoomController`: Placement logic, harmony meter, completion sequence.
- `CameraController`: Orbit mode + zoom transitions.

**Visual Feedback:**
- Semi-transparent ghost objects (30-40% opacity) at empty placement spots.
- Highlight shader when cursor centers on spot.
- Real items replace ghosts after placement.
- Room lighting evolves as harmony meter fills.

**Data-driven rooms:** ScriptableObjects define lighting, theme, and mini-game difficulty (future expansion).

**Art:** Free CC0 textures (tatami, fusuma, wood) and simple 3D geometry.

**Sound:** Gentle ambience, chimes on selection, paper/ink SFX.

## üóìÔ∏è Development Progress

**‚úÖ Completed:**
- GameManager state flow system with events.
- Lantern mini-game with progress bar UI (LanternGame, LanternUI, LanternVisual).
- Camera controller with coroutine-based smooth transitions.
- MiniGameController transition system (success ‚Üí room ‚Üí placement).
- Event-driven architecture (mini-game completion ‚Üí transition ‚Üí placement).

**üöß In Progress:**
- Camera orbit system for room exploration.
- Placement spot selection with raycast and highlights.

**üìã Next Steps:**
1. Implement camera orbit controller with rotation limits and center cursor targeting.
2. Create placement spot system (Transform markers, PlacementSpot data class).
3. Add semi-transparent ghost objects for empty spots.
4. Implement spot highlighting and click-to-start mini-game flow.
5. Build placement mode UI (highlight valid spots, click to place).
6. Test full loop: explore ‚Üí select spot ‚Üí play ‚Üí place ‚Üí repeat √ó 3.
7. Clone Lantern logic for Origami (arrow keys) and Calligraphy (brush rhythm).
8. Implement harmony meter and room completion animation.
9. Integrate audio and polish lighting transitions.
10. Playtest and adjust configurable timing parameters.
"}

response.value:
# üèóÔ∏è Room System Architecture: Exploration to Placement

Let me break down the room system into logical components and define clear responsibilities.

---

## **üéØ Room Lifecycle Overview:**

```
Room Initialization
    ‚Üì
Exploration Mode (player looks around)
    ‚Üì
Spot Selection (cursor on ghost ‚Üí highlight)
    ‚Üì
Spot Activation (click ‚Üí trigger mini-game)
    ‚Üì
[Mini-game plays]
    ‚Üì
Return to Room
    ‚Üì
Placement Mode (highlight valid spots for completed item)
    ‚Üì
Placement Confirmation (click spot ‚Üí item appears)
    ‚Üì
Update Room State (ghost removed, harmony increased)
    ‚Üì
[Loop back to Exploration if < 3 items]
    ‚Üì
Room Completion (all 3 placed)
```

---

## **üìã RoomController Responsibilities:**

### **Primary Role: Room State & Placement Logic**

**What RoomController Should Handle:**

#### **1. Placement Spot Management**
- Store list of all `PlacementSpot` objects in room
- Track which spots are occupied vs. available
- Know which mini-game corresponds to each spot
- Provide "get valid spots for item type" query

#### **2. Room State Tracking**
- Count items placed (0/3, 1/3, 2/3, 3/3)
- Track which mini-games have been completed
- Store references to placed item GameObjects
- Know current phase (exploration, placing, complete)

#### **3. Spot Interaction Logic**
- **During Exploration:** Which spots can be clicked to start games?
  - Only unoccupied spots
  - OR all spots (can replay mini-games?)
  - Decision: Probably only empty spots
  
- **During Placement:** Which spots can receive current item?
  - Filter by item type compatibility
  - Exclude occupied spots
  - Highlight valid options

#### **4. Placement Execution**
- Receive item placement request (which spot, which item)
- Instantiate/move item GameObject to spot position/rotation
- Mark spot as occupied
- Remove ghost object at that spot
- Fire "OnItemPlaced" event
- Update harmony meter

#### **5. Harmony Meter**
- Calculate harmony level (items placed / 3)
- Update UI harmony meter
- Trigger visual changes (lighting, particles) as harmony increases
- Fire "OnRoomComplete" when 3/3 placed

#### **6. Room Completion Sequence**
- Detect when all 3 items placed
- Trigger completion animation/effects
- Maybe pan camera across items
- Show completion UI
- Enable "Next Room" or "Return to Menu" options

#### **7. Spot Highlighting System**

## **üìã CameraController Responsibilities:**

### **Primary Role: Camera Movement & Player View**

**What CameraController Should Handle:**

#### **1. Orbit Mode (Exploration)**

- Smooth damping on input (not instant snap)

#### **2. Input Handling for Orbit**

- Apply smoothly to camera transform

#### **3. Center Cursor Raycast**

- Detect what placement spot is being looked at

#### **4. Zoom Transitions (to/from mini-games)**
- Move from orbit position ‚Üí placement spot position

- Lock orbit controls during transition
- Return to previous orbit angle after mini-game

#### **5. Placement Mode Camera**
- During placement, maybe restrict rotation more?
- Or keep full orbit to help player see all options?

## **üîó How They Work Together:**

### **Exploration Phase:**

```
CameraController:
    - Player rotates camera with mouse/stick
    - Raycasts from center to detect spots
    - Fires "OnSpotTargeted(spot)" event when cursor centers on spot
    
RoomController:
    - Listens to OnSpotTargeted
    - Checks if spot is valid (unoccupied, correct phase)
    - Enables highlight on that spot
    - Waits for click input

PlayerInput (could be in RoomController or separate):
    - Detects click/button press
    - If spot is targeted ‚Üí RoomController.OnSpotClicked(spot)
    
RoomController.OnSpotClicked():
    - Determine which mini-game for this spot
    - Tell GameManager to start that mini-game
    - Store context (which spot triggered it)
    
GameManager:
    - Changes state to PlayingMiniGame
    - MiniGameController starts appropriate game
    - CameraController zooms to spot position
```

### **Post Mini-Game Phase:**

```
MiniGameController:
    - Mini-game completes
    - Shows success UI
    - Camera transitions back to room
    - Fires OnMiniGameFullyComplete(result)
    
GameManager:
    - Changes state to PlacingItem
    - Tells RoomController: "Item X is ready to place"
    
RoomController.EnterPlacementMode(itemType):
    - Get list of valid spots for this item type
    - Highlight those spots
    - Disable exploration (can't start new games now)
    - Wait for player to choose spot
    
CameraController:
    - Re-enters orbit mode
    - Player can rotate to see all valid spots
    - Raycast still active for spot targeting
    
PlayerInput:
    - Click on valid highlighted spot
    
RoomController.PlaceItem(spot, item):
    - Instantiate item at spot position
    - Deactivate ghost object
    - Mark spot as occupied
    - Increment items placed counter
    - Update harmony meter (33% ‚Üí 66% ‚Üí 100%)
    - Check if room complete (3/3)
    - If not complete: return to exploration mode
    - If complete: trigger completion sequence
```

## **üéÆ Input Flow Decision:**

**Question: Who handles the click input?**

### **Option A: RoomController handles all input**
```
RoomController.Update():
    if (Input.GetMouseButtonDown(0))
    {
        if (currentState == Exploration && targetedSpot != null)
            ‚Üí StartMiniGame(targetedSpot)
        
        if (currentState == Placement && targetedSpot != null)
            ‚Üí PlaceItem(targetedSpot)
    }
```
**Pros:** Centralized, easy to understand
**Cons:** RoomController gets messy with input code

### **Option B: Separate InputHandler**
```
RoomInputHandler:
    - Reads click input
    - Asks CameraController: "What are we looking at?"
    - Asks RoomController: "Is this valid to click?"

```
**Pros:** Clean separation, testable

### **Option C: PlacementSpot handles own clicks**
```
PlacementSpot script:
    - Has collider

    - Fires event to RoomController
```
**Pros:** Object-oriented, spots are self-contained
**Cons:** Requires colliders, harder to control when spots are clickable

**Recommendation: Option A for now** (simple, gets it working), refactor to Option B later if needed.

## **üéØ Suggested Approach:**

**Start with simplest version:**
- 4 spots (wall, 3 floor positions)
- Each spot triggers specific mini-game (no choice)
- After game, item auto-places at that spot (no choice)
- **This removes placement mode complexity initially**

**Then add flexibility:**
- After mini-game, show multiple valid spots
- Player chooses where to place
- Calligraphy still locked to wall

- Get basic loop working fast
- Add complexity incrementally
- Easier to test and debug

5. Deactivates ghost, marks occupied
6. Test: Complete game ‚Üí place item ‚Üí ghost disappears

### **Phase 6: Room State Tracking**
1. Track items placed counter
2. Update harmony meter UI
3. Check for 3/3 completion
4. Fire completion event
5. Prevent selecting occupied spots

### **Phase 7: Polish**
1. Replace cube ghosts with proper semi-transparent models
2. Add highlight shader with emission
3. Smooth transitions (ghost fade out, item fade in)
4. Audio feedback on selection/placement
5. Lighting changes as room fills

---

## **‚ùì Open Questions:**

1. **Spot Reusability:**
   - Can player click occupied spots to replay mini-games?
   - Or locked once placed?
   - **Recommendation:** Locked (prevents confusion, enforces 3-item limit)

2. **Placement Flexibility:**
   - After completing Lantern, can choose Floor-L, Floor-R, or Floor-F?
   - **Yes** based on your earlier decision (flexible for lantern/origami)
   
3. **Spot-Game Mapping:**
   - Does Wall spot ALWAYS trigger Calligraphy?
   - Do Floor spots trigger Origami OR Lantern (player chooses)?
   - **Proposal:** Each spot has fixed mini-game trigger
     - Wall ‚Üí Calligraphy only
     - Floor-L ‚Üí Origami only  
     - Floor-R ‚Üí Lantern only
     - Floor-F ‚Üí Player's choice? Or one is locked?
   
   **Alternative:** All floor spots can trigger any mini-game, placement is flexible after
   
4. **Camera During Placement:**
   - Keep full orbit freedom?
   - **Yes** - helps player see all valid spots

5. **Ghost Visuals:**
   - Start with simple cubes/outlines?
   - **Yes** - replace with proper models later

6. **Highlight Feedback:**
   - Just emission glow?
   - Or also outline shader, particles, audio?
   - **Start simple:** Emission only, add polish later

---

## **üéØ Core Loop Summary:**

# üèóÔ∏è Room System Architecture: Exploration to Placement

Let me break down the room system into logical components and define clear responsibilities.

---

## **üéØ Room Lifecycle Overview:**

```
Room Initialization
    ‚Üì
Exploration Mode (player looks around)
    ‚Üì
Spot Selection (cursor on ghost ‚Üí highlight)
    ‚Üì
Spot Activation (click ‚Üí trigger mini-game)
    ‚Üì
[Mini-game plays]
    ‚Üì
Return to Room
    ‚Üì
Placement Mode (highlight valid spots for completed item)
    ‚Üì
Placement Confirmation (click spot ‚Üí item appears)
    ‚Üì
Update Room State (ghost removed, harmony increased)
    ‚Üì
[Loop back to Exploration if < 3 items]
    ‚Üì
Room Completion (all 3 placed)
```

---

## **üìã RoomController Responsibilities:**

### **Primary Role: Room State & Placement Logic**

**What RoomController Should Handle:**

#### **1. Placement Spot Management**
- Store list of all `PlacementSpot` objects in room
- Track which spots are occupied vs. available
- Know which mini-game corresponds to each spot
- Provide "get valid spots for item type" query

#### **2. Room State Tracking**
- Count items placed (0/3, 1/3, 2/3, 3/3)
- Track which mini-games have been completed
- Store references to placed item GameObjects
- Know current phase (exploration, placing, complete)

#### **3. Spot Interaction Logic**
- **During Exploration:** Which spots can be clicked to start games?
  - Only unoccupied spots
  - OR all spots (can replay mini-games?)
  - Decision: Probably only empty spots
  
- **During Placement:** Which spots can receive current item?
  - Filter by item type compatibility
  - Exclude occupied spots
  - Highlight valid options

#### **4. Placement Execution**
- Receive item placement request (which spot, which item)
- Instantiate/move item GameObject to spot position/rotation
- Mark spot as occupied
- Remove ghost object at that spot
- Fire "OnItemPlaced" event
- Update harmony meter

#### **5. Harmony Meter**
- Calculate harmony level (items placed / 3)
- Update UI harmony meter
- Trigger visual changes (lighting, particles) as harmony increases
- Fire "OnRoomComplete" when 3/3 placed

#### **6. Room Completion Sequence**
- Detect when all 3 items placed
- Trigger completion animation/effects
- Maybe pan camera across items
- Show completion UI
- Enable "Next Room" or "Return to Menu" options

#### **7. Spot Highlighting System**
- Enable/disable highlights on placement spots
- Different highlight modes:
  - Exploration: subtle pulse on available spots
  - Placement: bright glow on valid spots
  - Hover: intensify when cursor centered

#### **8. Ghost Object Management**
- Show/hide ghost objects based on occupation
- Maybe fade out ghosts when item placed
- Could animate transition (ghost ‚Üí real item)

---

## **üìã CameraController Responsibilities:**

### **Primary Role: Camera Movement & Player View**

**What CameraController Should Handle:**

#### **1. Orbit Mode (Exploration)**
- Rotate camera around fixed orbit point
- Apply rotation limits (min/max horizontal/vertical)
- Smooth damping on input (not instant snap)
- Store current rotation angles

#### **2. Input Handling for Orbit**
- Read mouse delta or controller stick
- Convert to rotation angles
- Clamp within bounds
- Apply smoothly to camera transform

#### **3. Center Cursor Raycast**
- Cast ray from camera center (screen center point)
- Detect what placement spot is being looked at
- Provide "currently targeted spot" property
- Maybe distance check (too far = no highlight)

#### **4. Zoom Transitions (to/from mini-games)**
- Move from orbit position ‚Üí placement spot position
- Smooth coroutine transition (already implemented)
- Lock orbit controls during transition
- Return to previous orbit angle after mini-game

#### **5. Placement Mode Camera**
- During placement, maybe restrict rotation more?
- Or keep full orbit to help player see all options?
- Decision needed: Free orbit or lock to spot view?

#### **6. Camera State Management**
- Know current mode: Orbiting, Transitioning, Locked (during mini-game)
- Disable orbit input when not in exploration mode
- Re-enable when returning to room

#### **7. Visual Feedback**
- Optional: Camera shake on item placement?
- Optional: Slow zoom out when room completes?
- Could signal camera target to other systems

---

## **üîó How They Work Together:**

### **Exploration Phase:**

```
CameraController:
    - Player rotates camera with mouse/stick
    - Raycasts from center to detect spots
    - Fires "OnSpotTargeted(spot)" event when cursor centers on spot
    
RoomController:
    - Listens to OnSpotTargeted
    - Checks if spot is valid (unoccupied, correct phase)
    - Enables highlight on that spot
    - Waits for click input

PlayerInput (could be in RoomController or separate):
    - Detects click/button press
    - If spot is targeted ‚Üí RoomController.OnSpotClicked(spot)
    
RoomController.OnSpotClicked():
    - Determine which mini-game for this spot
    - Tell GameManager to start that mini-game
    - Store context (which spot triggered it)
    
GameManager:
    - Changes state to PlayingMiniGame
    - MiniGameController starts appropriate game
    - CameraController zooms to spot position
```

### **Post Mini-Game Phase:**

```
MiniGameController:
    - Mini-game completes
    - Shows success UI
    - Camera transitions back to room
    - Fires OnMiniGameFullyComplete(result)
    
GameManager:
    - Changes state to PlacingItem
    - Tells RoomController: "Item X is ready to place"
    
RoomController.EnterPlacementMode(itemType):
    - Get list of valid spots for this item type
    - Highlight those spots
    - Disable exploration (can't start new games now)
    - Wait for player to choose spot
    
CameraController:
    - Re-enters orbit mode
    - Player can rotate to see all valid spots
    - Raycast still active for spot targeting
    
PlayerInput:
    - Click on valid highlighted spot
    
RoomController.PlaceItem(spot, item):
    - Instantiate item at spot position
    - Deactivate ghost object
    - Mark spot as occupied
    - Increment items placed counter
    - Update harmony meter (33% ‚Üí 66% ‚Üí 100%)
    - Check if room complete (3/3)
    - If not complete: return to exploration mode
    - If complete: trigger completion sequence
```

---

## **üéÆ Input Flow Decision:**

**Question: Who handles the click input?**

### **Option A: RoomController handles all input**
```
RoomController.Update():
    if (Input.GetMouseButtonDown(0))
    {
        if (currentState == Exploration && targetedSpot != null)
            ‚Üí StartMiniGame(targetedSpot)
        
        if (currentState == Placement && targetedSpot != null)
            ‚Üí PlaceItem(targetedSpot)
    }
```
**Pros:** Centralized, easy to understand
**Cons:** RoomController gets messy with input code

### **Option B: Separate InputHandler**
```
RoomInputHandler:
    - Reads click input
    - Asks CameraController: "What are we looking at?"
    - Asks RoomController: "Is this valid to click?"
    - If yes: Fires appropriate event
```
**Pros:** Clean separation, testable
**Cons:** Another script to manage

### **Option C: PlacementSpot handles own clicks**
```
PlacementSpot script:
    - Has collider
    - OnMouseDown() when clicked
    - Fires event to RoomController
```
**Pros:** Object-oriented, spots are self-contained
**Cons:** Requires colliders, harder to control when spots are clickable

**Recommendation: Option A for now** (simple, gets it working), refactor to Option B later if needed.

---

## **üì¶ Data Structures Needed:**

### **PlacementSpot Class:**

```
PlacementSpot (MonoBehaviour on empty GameObjects):
    - Transform transform (position/rotation for items)
    - PlacementType allowedTypes (Calligraphy, Origami, Lantern)
    - MiniGameType triggersGame (which game this spot starts)
    - bool isOccupied
    - GameObject ghostObject (reference to semi-transparent visual)
    - GameObject placedItem (reference to real item after placement)
    - Renderer highlightRenderer (for glow effect)
    - Material highlightMaterial (changes emission on highlight)
    
    Methods:
    - SetHighlight(bool active, HighlightMode mode)
    - CanAcceptItemType(itemType) ‚Üí bool
    - PlaceItem(GameObject item)
```

### **HighlightMode Enum:**
```
HighlightMode:
    - None (no highlight)
    - Available (subtle pulse - can be selected)
    - Targeted (medium glow - cursor is on it)
    - Valid (bright glow - valid for placement)
```

### **PlacementType Enum:**
```
PlacementType (Flags):
    - Calligraphy = 1
    - Origami = 2
    - Lantern = 4
    
Allows:
    Wall spot: PlacementType.Calligraphy
    Floor spot: PlacementType.Origami | PlacementType.Lantern
```

### **MiniGameType Enum (already exists):**
```
MiniGameType:
    - Origami
    - Calligraphy
    - Lantern
```

---

## **üé® Visual Feedback Responsibilities:**

### **Who Makes Things Glow?**

**PlacementSpot:**
- Controls own highlight state
- Has reference to highlight material
- Receives commands: "Highlight as Available" or "Highlight as Valid"

**RoomController:**
- Decides WHICH spots should highlight
- Tells spots to enable/disable highlights
- Doesn't know HOW highlighting works (just calls spot.SetHighlight())

**CameraController:**
- Reports which spot is centered
- Doesn't know about highlighting (just provides targeting info)

---

## **üîÑ State Machine in RoomController:**

### **Room States:**

```
RoomState:
    - Initializing (loading, setting up spots)
    - Exploration (player looking around, can select spots)
    - WaitingForMiniGame (game starting, camera zooming)
    - MiniGameActive (game playing, room inactive)
    - Placement (choosing where to place completed item)
    - Completing (all 3 placed, playing completion animation)
    - Complete (room finished, showing summary)
```

### **State Behaviors:**

**Exploration:**
- Enable orbit camera controls
- Show "Available" highlights on unoccupied spots
- Raycast active for targeting
- Clicks start mini-games

**Placement:**
- Enable orbit camera controls (still)
- Show "Valid" highlights only on compatible, unoccupied spots
- Raycast active for targeting
- Clicks place items

**MiniGameActive:**
- Disable orbit controls
- Disable all highlights
- No raycast needed
- Wait for game completion

---

## **üéØ Interaction with Other Systems:**

### **RoomController ‚Üî GameManager:**

**RoomController fires events:**
- `OnSpotActivated(MiniGameType gameType, PlacementSpot spot)`
- `OnItemPlaced(PlacementSpot spot, GameObject item)`
- `OnRoomComplete()`

**GameManager listens:**
- OnSpotActivated ‚Üí ChangeState(PlayingMiniGame), tell MiniGameController which game
- OnItemPlaced ‚Üí Update progress tracking
- OnRoomComplete ‚Üí ChangeState(RoomCompletion)

### **RoomController ‚Üî MiniGameController:**

**Indirect communication via GameManager:**
- RoomController doesn't directly start mini-games
- GameManager is the middleman

**Or direct reference (simpler):**
- RoomController has reference to MiniGameController
- RoomController.StartMiniGameForSpot(spot) ‚Üí MiniGameController.StartGame(type)

### **RoomController ‚Üî CameraController:**

**RoomController queries camera:**
- `CameraController.GetTargetedSpot()` ‚Üí PlacementSpot or null
- `CameraController.IsMoving` ‚Üí bool (to know when transitions done)

**RoomController doesn't command camera:**
- GameManager/MiniGameController handles camera zoom commands
- RoomController just needs to know what player is looking at

---

## **üèóÔ∏è Implementation Phases:**

### **Phase 1: Basic Spot System**
1. Create PlacementSpot script with basic properties
2. Place 4 empty GameObjects in scene (wall, floor-L, floor-R, floor-F)
3. Assign PlacementSpot script to each
4. Configure allowed types per spot
5. Add simple cube as ghost visual

### **Phase 2: Camera Targeting**
1. Add raycast from camera center in CameraController
2. Detect which PlacementSpot is centered
3. Store as `targetedSpot` property
4. Draw debug line to show raycast

### **Phase 3: Spot Highlighting**
1. Add highlight material to spot GameObjects
2. Implement SetHighlight() in PlacementSpot
3. RoomController enables highlight on targeted spot
4. Test: Look at spot ‚Üí it glows

### **Phase 4: Spot Click ‚Üí Mini-Game**
1. RoomController detects click on targeted spot
2. Determine which mini-game (spot.triggersGame)
3. Tell GameManager/MiniGameController to start it
4. Camera zooms to spot position
5. Test: Click spot ‚Üí lantern game starts

### **Phase 5: Placement Flow**
1. After mini-game, GameManager tells RoomController to enter placement mode
2. RoomController highlights valid spots for item type
3. Player clicks valid spot
4. RoomController instantiates item prefab at spot
5. Deactivates ghost, marks occupied
6. Test: Complete game ‚Üí place item ‚Üí ghost disappears

### **Phase 6: Room State Tracking**
1. Track items placed counter
2. Update harmony meter UI
3. Check for 3/3 completion
4. Fire completion event
5. Prevent selecting occupied spots

### **Phase 7: Polish**
1. Replace cube ghosts with proper semi-transparent models
2. Add highlight shader with emission
3. Smooth transitions (ghost fade out, item fade in)
4. Audio feedback on selection/placement
5. Lighting changes as room fills

---

## **‚ùì Open Questions:**

1. **Spot Reusability:**
   - Can player click occupied spots to replay mini-games?
   - Or locked once placed?
   - **Recommendation:** Locked (prevents confusion, enforces 3-item limit)

2. **Placement Flexibility:**
   - After completing Lantern, can choose Floor-L, Floor-R, or Floor-F?
   - **Yes** based on your earlier decision (flexible for lantern/origami)
   
3. **Spot-Game Mapping:**
   - Does Wall spot ALWAYS trigger Calligraphy?
   - Do Floor spots trigger Origami OR Lantern (player chooses)?
   - **Proposal:** Each spot has fixed mini-game trigger
     - Wall ‚Üí Calligraphy only
     - Floor-L ‚Üí Origami only  
     - Floor-R ‚Üí Lantern only
     - Floor-F ‚Üí Player's choice? Or one is locked?
   
   **Alternative:** All floor spots can trigger any mini-game, placement is flexible after
   
4. **Camera During Placement:**
   - Keep full orbit freedom?
   - **Yes** - helps player see all valid spots

5. **Ghost Visuals:**
   - Start with simple cubes/outlines?
   - **Yes** - replace with proper models later

6. **Highlight Feedback:**
   - Just emission glow?
   - Or also outline shader, particles, audio?
   - **Start simple:** Emission only, add polish later

---

## **üéØ Core Loop Summary:**

```
1. Room loads ‚Üí 4 spots with ghosts visible
2. Player orbits camera to look around
3. Cursor centers on Floor-L spot ‚Üí highlight glows
4. Player clicks ‚Üí RoomController.OnSpotClicked(Floor-L)
5. RoomController determines: Floor-L triggers Origami
6. RoomController tells GameManager: StartMiniGame(Origami)
7. GameManager ‚Üí MiniGameController.StartOrigami()
8. Camera zooms to Floor-L position
9. [Origami mini-game plays]
10. Game completes ‚Üí camera returns to room orbit
11. RoomController.EnterPlacementMode(OrigamiItem)
12. RoomController highlights Floor-L, Floor-R, Floor-F (valid for Origami)
13. Player rotates camera, looks at Floor-R
14. Player clicks ‚Üí RoomController.PlaceItem(Floor-R, origamiPrefab)
15. Origami appears at Floor-R, ghost fades out
16. Harmony meter: 33% ‚Üí visual feedback
17. Return to exploration mode (1/3 items placed)
18. Repeat for Calligraphy and Lantern
19. 3/3 placed ‚Üí Room completion sequence
```

---

## **üéØ Suggested Approach:**

**Start with simplest version:**
- 4 spots (wall, 3 floor positions)
- Each spot triggers specific mini-game (no choice)
- After game, item auto-places at that spot (no choice)
- **This removes placement mode complexity initially**

**Then add flexibility:**
- After mini-game, show multiple valid spots
- Player chooses where to place
- Calligraphy still locked to wall

**Benefits:**
- Get basic loop working fast
- Add complexity incrementally
- Easier to test and debug

**Which approach do you prefer?** ü§î
